column4: Not sure what your question is.  What exactly are you trying to do?  What is your end goal.
i want to format my second hard drive, it has multiple partitions but they are NTFS, EXT and one swap..
but just wnat to have 2 partitions ext4
Well, if you are not using those other partitions, just blow them away and put what you want on it.
no im using the DISK UTILITY tool of Gnome on ubuntu 10.10

Ok, well as long as you are not using those partitions, go on with it.  If that swap partion is in use by your current system you might want to keep it on there some place... but you probably already have a swap partition on the other drive, right?
yes i already have another swap partition
You should be good to go then.
i just want to format the entire second hard drive
yes but on the disk utility options, on the Formatting options there is the MASTER BOOT RECORDER, and the GUID prtition table
GUID is just a standard for the layout of the partition table on a physical hard disk.
so the Master boot recorder should be fine?

I just use fdisk for what you are doing.  Since this drive is not in use by your current system, (or any other for that matter, you can do what you like with it).  I don't know much about the options you are seeing in the particular partitioning utility you are using, but yes MBR is find.
